intro: Polygala guantanamana, commonly known as the Guantánamo milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Polygalaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native region. Its small, compound leaves and unique floral structure are notable botanical features. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
